alert.note: Alert for Eureka (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 14 at 2:06AM PDT by NWS Elko
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM PDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...A portion of north central Nevada, including the following county, Eureka. * WHEN...Until 1100 PM PDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 206 AM PDT, Emergency management and County Sheriff`s office are reporting flooding in the warned area. Flooding is already occurring. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Eureka, Garden Pass, Grass Valley, Diamond Valley, Pine Valley, Eureka Airport, Crescent Valley, Palisade, Beowawe, Pinto Summit, Emigrant Pass, Dunphy, Antelope Peak, South Area Mine and North Area Mine. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
